Little emoji survey!

Successfully run of a query is also indicated by a green checkmark (pink circle)

:helmet_with_white_cross:: If you couldn't achieve that and need help

text: no prob -this is also super interesting - comparing the emissions of vans in european countries year on year - <https://www.eea.europa.eu/data-and-maps/data/vans-15> i did not know this was something that was tracked!

attachments.text: The Regulation (EU) No 2019/631 (and before that Regulation (EU) No 510/2011) requires Member States to record information for each new van registered in its territory. Every year, each Member State shall submit to the Commission all the information related to their new registrations. In particular, the following details are required for each new van registered: manufacturer name, type approval number, type, variant, version, make and commercial name, specific emissions of CO2, mass of the vehicle, wheel base, track width, fuel type and fuel mode. Additional information, such as engine power and engine capacity were also submitted. Data for EU-28 are reported in the main database. Since 2018 Iceland and since 2019 Norway are also included in the database.
attachments.fallback: The Regulation (EU) No 2019/631 (and before that Regulation (EU) No 510/2011) requires Member States to record information for each new van registered in its territory. Every year, each Member State shall submit to the Commission all the information related to their new registrations. In particular, the following details are required for each new van registered: manufacturer name, type approval number, type, variant, version, make and commercial name, specific emissions of CO2, mass of the vehicle, wheel base, track width, fuel type and fuel mode. Additional information, such as engine power and engine capacity were also submitted. Data for EU-28 are reported in the main database. Since 2018 Iceland and since 2019 Norway are also included in the database.

text:
<!channel>,
also make sure, you have the *Bank Database* imported for next week (task is linked in Notion, _Student Set up for MySQL_). I've went through it with couple of you. But in case you don't have it yet. Here's the instruction for MySQL Workbench. It comes as a "full package", meaning a "sql dumpfile" (we don't have to care about seperated data & schema files)
1. Download the `mysql_dump.sql` from <https://github.com/ironhack-edu/data_case_study_2/blob/master/mysql_dump.sql|here> (rightclick on Download, "Save link as...")
2. In your Workbench, go on *Server* -> *Data Import* :one:*.* Select the Option "*Import from Self-Contained File*" :two:, select in the field there the path to your `mysql_dump.sql` file you downloaded.
3. Press on *Start Import,* :three: (that field might be hidden a bit. you might need to maximize your Workbench window). Import should take a couple of seconds
4. press the Refresh Button in the _Schemas_ field :four: . The bank database should then appear there

text:
aha! you will need to pivot the data so that all the years are one column, and all the values another column. pivoting you can do in tableau or in python. in tableau it looks like this <https://help.tableau.com/current/pro/desktop/en-us/pivot.htm>
and you do it by selecting all those columns in the data source window (use shift + select to do it quicker)

attachments.title: Pivot Data from Columns to Rows
attachments.text: Sometimes, analyzing data that is stored in a crosstab format can be difficult in Tableau
attachments.fallback: Pivot Data from Columns to Rows
